page.title: 08GREYSTONES COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: Greystones was built as a private house in 1913 for Captain and Mrs. Denison. They owned the land from Montagu Road to the sea and from Waterford Road to Chewton Bunny. Since it was built it has had a new roof put on. Greystones is now owned by the Highcliffe Community Association on a 99 year lease. The estimated cost of restoration and conversion was Â£350,000. In 1984/5 Greystones is a Grade Two listed building but it was empty for nearly 10 years. Children have half-term activities at the centre like drawing, games, making things, reading and dancing. Adults can have meetings, go to exhibitions, have coffee mornings and have their meals on wheels. The meals would be for old people perhaps not able to shop. Many live nearby. By Suzannah Phillips; Jilla Ferguson.
